head.title: National News Briefs; Energy Dept. Tightens Policy on Its Contractors

hedline.hl1: National News Briefs; Energy Dept. Tightens Policy on Its Contractors

abstract.p: Energy Sec Bill Richardson says Dept of Energy is frustrated by performance of contractors it hires to run its nuclear weapons plants; it demands right to fire contractors' top managers and control managers' bonuses in future contracts (S)

block.p: Frustrated by the performance of the contractors that it hires to run its nuclear weapons plants, the Department of Energy will demand the right to fire the contractors' top managers and control the managers' bonuses in future contracts, Secretary Bill Richardson said today.

In addition, under the new policy, decisions on what goals to set for contractors and whether the contracting companies have met those goals and should earn bonuses, will be reviewed directly by the energy secretary. Previously, such decisions were usually made by senior civil servants, not the secretary.

Frustrated by the performance of the contractors that it hires to run its nuclear weapons plants, the Department of Energy will demand the right to fire the contractors' top managers and control the managers' bonuses in future contracts, Secretary Bill Richardson said today.

In addition, under the new policy, decisions on what goals to set for contractors and whether the contracting companies have met those goals and should earn bonuses, will be reviewed directly by the energy secretary. Previously, such decisions were usually made by senior civil servants, not the secretary.
''I'm trying to end the cozy relationship between the department and its contractors,'' Mr. Richardson said in an interview, adding, ''The department has not exercised proper oversight.''
